definition: sensible act
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
wisdom/knowledge
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]

sentences.english: At this time, avoid to defeat psychological, not tired is wise.
sentences.chinese: 此时，切忌不甘失败的心理，不恋战是明智之举。

sentences.english: People would be wise to abandon rash inclinations and instead try in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 人们摒弃急燥冒进并代之以严肃认识是明智之举。

sentences.english: file2.txt.bak, and file3.txt.bak. Mistakes happen, so making a backup is smart.
sentences.chinese: 错误操作时常发生，所以建立备份是明智之举。

sentences.english: But deciding to relocate based on statistics is not advisable.
sentences.chinese: 但是根据这些统计数据去搬迁并非明智之举。

sentences.english: It is thus wise for the Chinese government to increase investment in technical schools.
sentences.chinese: 因此，中国政府加大对职业技校的投资时明智之举。

sentences.english: To get a good mortgage deal and terms it would be wise to look around the internet.
sentences.chinese: 取得了良好的条件和抵押协议是明智之举四顾互联网。

sentences.english: It would be advisable for you to instruct a credit agency to investigate the matter.
sentences.chinese: 贵方指示信用调查机构调查这件事是明智之举。

sentences.english: It is also wise to obtain news from more balanced news sources.
sentences.chinese: 在更多均衡的资源上获取新闻也是种明智之举。

sentences.english: She deemed it wise to refuse the offer.
sentences.chinese: 她认为拒绝这个建议是明智之举。

sentences.english: So coequal material compares the price just is advisability to lift.
sentences.chinese: 所以同等材料比较价格才是明智之举。

sentences.english: Putting your savings in a high-interest account is a good bet.
sentences.chinese: 把你的积蓄存进高利率储蓄户头是明智之举。

sentences.english: While spite may be a good motivator, revenge is typically a lousy use of resources.
sentences.chinese: 置之不理实乃明智之举，报复是典型的糟蹋资源。

sentences.english: Egan acknowledges that expanding BlackBerry's enterprise services and features is a good move.
sentences.chinese: 伊根承认，扩展黑莓的企业服务和功能是明智之举。

definition: the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
sensible/wise/judicious/sagacious
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to blunder/to miscalculate/miscalculation/unwise (move)
top priority job/matter of vital importance
stratagem of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift plan/interim step
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
indeed/true! (I agree with you)
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
eager to/in a hurry to
good plan/good idea
